metadata.title: CVE-2021-47239 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS (noble) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: net:usb: fix possible use-after-free in smsc75xx_bind The commit 46a8b29c6306("net: usb: fix memory leak in smsc75xx_bind") fails to clean up the workscheduled in smsc75xx_reset-> smsc75xx_set_multicast, which leads touse-after-free if the work is scheduled to start after the deallocation. Inaddition, this patch also removes a dangling pointer - dev->data[0]. Thispatch calls cancel_work_sync to cancel the scheduled work and set thedangling pointer to NULL.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-47239` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.5.0-9-generic - 6.5.0-9.9
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-9-generic - 6.5.0-9.9
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-9-generic-64k - 6.5.0-9.9
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1008-aws - 6.5.0-1008.8
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1007-azure - 6.5.0-1007.7
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1007-gcp - 6.5.0-1007.7
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1003-gke - 6.8.0-1003.5
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1009-ibm - 6.5.0-1009.9
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-9-lowlatency - 6.5.0-9.9.1
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-9-lowlatency-64k - 6.5.0-9.9.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1010-oracle - 6.5.0-1010.10
No subscription required

linux-image-6.5.0-1005-raspi - 6.5.0-1005.7
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1003-oem - 6.8.0-1003.3
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1005-intel - 6.8.0-1001.6
No subscription required
